properties.notes: demolition of existing buildings and redevelopment to provide 210 dwellings

properties.notes: Developability of this site will depend on the viability of the existing uses. Theoretical density (90% of site at 60 DPH) = 45. Given edge of Green Belt location assume 35.
properties.ownership-status: not owned by a public authority

properties.name: BR3/04/0009
properties.site-address: Dorset Soldier PH, Wareham Road, Corfe Mullen
properties.notes: Site submitted by landowner as part of Local Plan Review 2017. Assessed potential of up to 12 dwellings which is realistic for a flatted scheme.
properties.ownership-status: not owned by a public authority

properties.name: BR3/07/0476
properties.notes: Garage site has potential for re-development, subject to the viability of the business. However, conversion to flats of the adjacent property suggests some likelihood that it will happen.. Potential assessed for 20 flats
properties.ownership-status: not owned by a public authority

properties.name: BR3/22/0670
properties.site-address: Verwood Industrial Estate, Black Hill, Verwood
properties.notes: This site is occupied by the Blackhill Industrial Estate and the adjacent builder's supplies depot. It is unlikely that the industrial estate will come forward for redevelopment in the near future. There is a greater likelihood is the builders merchants. Approximately 25 dwellings.
properties.ownership-status: not owned by a public authority

properties.name: BR3/25/0416
properties.site-address: Northern Portion Flight Refuelling Site, Brook Road, Wimborne
properties.notes: Landowner has also expressed an interest in releasing the land for housing or a foodstore. There is a current live application for additional parking so consider only 50% of the site available for housing currently so approximately 50 dwellings.. Approximately 50 dwellings.
properties.ownership-status: not owned by a public authority

properties.name: BR3/25/0423
properties.notes: A well located site with excellent links to the town centre and transport links. However the landowner has expressed viability issues in the current economic climate.
properties.ownership-status: not owned by a public authority

properties.name: BR3/25/0438
properties.site-address: British Legion Club, West Borough, Wimborne
properties.notes: Potential for complete redevelopment of site for flats or mews cottages
properties.ownership-status: not owned by a public authority

properties.name: BR3/25/0477
properties.notes: 6 flats granted as permitted development.
properties.ownership-status: not owned by a public authority

properties.name: BR3/03/0095
properties.notes: The Furzehill Council Offices were considered surplus to requirements following the partnership working between Christchurch and East Dorset Councils.
properties.ownership-status: owned by a public authority

properties.name: BR3/03/0464
properties.site-address: Post Office and Co-op, Smugglers Lane, Colehill
properties.notes: The Post Office and shop are unlikely to come forward in the near future as the building has recently been refurbished and just retained the post office. It may come forward towards the end of the period for flats.
properties.ownership-status: not owned by a public authority

properties.name: BR3/07/0117
properties.site-address: The Post Office and 124 Ringwood Road, Longham
properties.notes: The site lies partially within the existing settlement boundary and partially within the green belt in an where an Exceptions Site may be acceptable
properties.ownership-status: not owned by a public authority

properties.name: BR3/07/0401
properties.notes: Two dwellings removed from original SHLAA site. Area to west outside of builders merchants site could come forward on its own. 25.08.17 Updated capacity to 80 units as within 60dph density zone and within urban area.
properties.ownership-status: not owned by a public authority

properties.name: BR3/16/0449
properties.site-address: Stone Lane Industrial Estate, Stone Lane, Pamphill
properties.notes: This is site of the new neighbourhood WMC6 at Stone Lane in the adopted Core Strategy. Scheduled for end of Plan period.
properties.ownership-status: not owned by a public authority

properties.name: BR3/21/0007
properties.site-address: Red Lion, Church Street, Sturminster Marshall
properties.notes: The site is within the existing settlement boundary, but the southern half of the site is affected by flood risk. There is though potential to convert the existing building into flats.
properties.ownership-status: not owned by a public authority

properties.name: BR3/23/0690
properties.site-address: Tap and Railway Public House, 195 Station Road, West Moors
properties.notes: This pub site would be suitable for high density flats, possibly over shops, as it lies between a sheltered housing scheme and a parade of shops with flats over in the commercial centre of the village
properties.ownership-status: not owned by a public authority

properties.name: BR3/23/0694
properties.site-address: West Moors Library, Station Road, West Moors
properties.notes: The Library site could be redeveloped for library/community uses on the ground floor with flats above. However, this is unlikely to happen until towards the end of the Plan period.
properties.ownership-status: owned by a public authority

properties.name: BR3/25/0758
properties.site-address: Car Park rear of 1-5, High Street
properties.notes: Allocated as a car park in the current Local Plan, will retain an important town centre car park function with the re ordering of The Square, where parking will be lost. Part of the site is Flood zone 3.
properties.ownership-status: not owned by a public authority

properties.name: BR3/25/0352
properties.notes: Half the original SHLAA site is within the curtilage of the Grade II* LB which has been removed from this brownfield entry. Away from the listed building, there is potential on the yard to the east.
properties.ownership-status: not owned by a public authority

properties.name: BR3/25/0485
properties.site-address: Old Road Car Park and Old Dairy, Wimborne
properties.notes: Marks Yard element of SHLAA site removed and shown as a separate Brownfield entry. EDDC have determined to dispose of the car park for housing (approx 8 units). The builder's office (former dairy) is now available, the latter may be towards the end of the plan period.
properties.ownership-status: mixed ownership

properties.name: BR3/25/0795
properties.notes: Potential to replace the old school buildings with sympathetically designed dwellings that will enhance the townscape and surveillance of the park.
properties.ownership-status: owned by a public authority

properties.name: BR3/25/0426
properties.notes: New dwellings potential amended from original SHLAA site analysis to omit back gardens. Potential with the Builders Hire Depot in the centre of the site - rather than with the Victorian cottages or modern flats
properties.ownership-status: not owned by a public authority

properties.name: BR3/25/0435
properties.notes: Potential conversion of Victorian building to provide 12 units if the Adult Education Centre no longer remains viable.
properties.ownership-status: owned by a public authority
